section.name: AndroMDA Profiles
section.p: People sometimes ask: "Can I change the stereotype names?, I really don't like using the capitalized <<Entity>> to denote an entity, I'd rather use the lowercase <<entity>> instead." Well in order to provide this ability to customize existing AndroMDA profiles (as well as creating your own), AndroMDA has the concept of customizable profile descriptors. This XML configuration file (which must be named andromda-profile.xml and reside in the META-INF directory) allows someone using AndroMDA to map stereotypes, tagged values, and data types to ANY names he or she wants without having to change ANY code.

Lets have a look at the contents of what a typical andromda-profile.xml file might contain (this snippet was taken from the UML metafacades andromda-profile.xml file):
<mappings name="uml"> <!-- stereotypes --> <mapping> <from>CRITERIA</from> <to>Criteria</to> </mapping> <mapping> <from>ENTITY</from> <to>Entity</to> </mapping> ... <!-- tagged values --> <mapping> <from>DOCUMENTATION</from> <to>documentation</to> </mapping> <mapping> <from>PERSISTENCE_TABLE</from> <to>@andromda.persistence.table</to> </mapping> <mapping> <from>PERSISTENCE_COLUMN</from> <to>@andromda.persistence.column</to> </mapping> <mapping> <from>PERSISTENCE_COLUMN_LENGTH</from> <to>@andromda.persistence.column.length</to> </mapping> ... <!-- datatypes --> <mapping> <from>COLLECTION_TYPE</from> <to>datatype::Collection</to> </mapping> <mapping> <from>LIST_TYPE</from> <to>datatype::List</to> </mapping> <mapping> <from>SET_TYPE</from> <to>datatype::Set</to> </mapping> ... </mappings>

If you'll familiar with AndroMDA mappings you'll notice that the above profile is in the same structure: you have the <from/> element which is the profile constant, and the <to/> element which is to what the constant should be mapped. These andromda-profile.xml files are loaded during AndroMDA startup and made available to the framework.

subsection.name: Overriding Profile Values
subsection.p:
In order to customize a specific profile mapping value, one must override that value by creating his/her own profile mapping and letting AndroMDA know its location by using the profileMappingsUri property. For example, this profile mappings file below would allow us to change the stereotype indentifying an entity to <<entity>> instead of the default <<Entity>> (the ENTITY profile constant is defined in the andromda-profile.xml of the UML metafacades jar which we saw above). Once we provide this customized mappings file AndroMDA will now recognize model elements with the stereotype <<entity>> :
<mappings name="CustomProfile"> ... <mapping> <from>ENTITY</from> <to>entity</to> </mapping> ... </mappings>
After writing your profile mappings file (the mappings named "CustomProfile" we wrote above), you'd then define the location of this mappings file as the namespace property profileMappingsUri (within the mda/project.xml file or your mda/build.xml if using Ant), like we do here (notice that the path must be a URI):
<namespace name="default"> <properties> ... <property name="profileMappingsUri">file:${basedir}/mda/conf/mappings/CustomizedProfileMappings.xml</property> ... </properties> </dnamespace>
